name: Hyatt Regency Vancouver

reviews.text: We booked our stay thru Priceline for $95.00. It was a beautiful room with a beautiful view. The front desk was extremely helpful. The location was great as Gastown and addl shopping nearby plus it's near where the cruise ships come in. I would highly recommend it to anyone. Lorie-Nebraska
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hyatt Regency Vancouver for 2 nights before getting on a cruise ship. The hotel was in a very good location directly next to a sky train station and very close to Robson street. I booked our room using Priceline after reading a few reviews at TripAdvisor and I paid 175 a night when most all hotels including Best Westerns were going 175+. I arrived with my wife and son at 11 a.m. on a Friday morning and was able to check in right away with no problem at all. I had room 907 which was one of two rooms per floor with a balcony. The rooms were extremely clean. I walked the room, lobby an hallways repeatedly with my 18 month old son in our sock and they only showed the slighted amounts of dirt, so I was very comfortable letting my son crawl or walk around the room. The room was well apponted and the beds were comfortable. The staff was extremely professional and friendly. They took care of whatever I needed right away. The only thing I didnt care for was that there was a lot of corners and edges in the room (the dressers and the desk) that I covered up with extra towels incase my little one took a header into them. I would absolutely stay here again. if I didn't have a toddler I wouldnt have had anything no matter how minor to say about this hotel.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel With A Friendly Staff

reviews.text: Check in was a little odd, as the front desk staff comes around the desk to a computer screen and helps you do a self check in.
reviews.title: Great Location & Service

reviews.text: Upgraded bedrooms start on the 20th floor and there are 34 floors with banquet space on the 34th - beautiful views.
reviews.title: Enjoyable experience

reviews.text: I got thankfully put on the 27th floor with a balcony - love the fresh air. Rooms are just like the pictures - newly renovated and gorgeous. Being a Starwood fan I do miss the Starwood showerhead. The trendy showerhead in the Hyatt isn't a showerhead at all, it's a square in the ceiling that rains down on you. For me with thick hair, it was pain getting the shampoo out with the lack of angle. Trendy is not always practical.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel is located in downtown and from there you can walk to most of Vancouver's attractions and restaurants. We arrived at 16h30 and our room was not ready yet (!).
reviews.title: great location. Good rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby is boring and doesn't feel like a 5 star place. But the rooms are very good and their signature bed is also great. We had a club room with a fantastic harbour view and access to a club lounge. But the lounge it was quite small and had poor amounts of food and drinks available. There is also a gym available for guests. It's well equiped and opened extended hours.
reviews.title: Very Nice!

reviews.text: Food in ther hotel restaurant is average and the staff is overall professional and friendly.
reviews.title: Run Away!!!!!!

likes.liked: — The manager and front desk staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In summary, a nice, confortable place. However it doesn't feel like a luxury hotel.
reviews.title: Great Bed, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the room through Priceline after an Alaskan cruise. The hotel was very nice. We had a wonderful view overlooking the Fairmount and the city. The location is perfect. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the lovely city of Vancouver.
reviews.title: Great picture windows with city and harbor view

likes.liked: — Picture windows offering great city views

reviews.text: We loved the Hyatt Vancouver. The rooms are absolutely fantastic. The bed extremely comfortable and all modern touches are supplied. Our room was quite with a great city view. I did go and look at the pool but didn't use it - wasn't up to the same standard as the rest of the hotel. The staff were excellent and the doorman greeted when we first arrived and remembered us for the rest of our trip. I used the internet access in the business centre which was very expensive. They do have wireless in the rooms but I leave my laptop at home when on holidays. Overall I'd highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Fantastic rooms

reviews.text: Stayed for 13 nights. Our second visit to Vancouver (previously stayed at the Fairmont Watrefront). Couldn't beat the location - near to shops and restaurants of Robson Street, Canada Place, and not far from Stanley Park. Excellent transport links directly outside the hotel, buses and sky train.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: Room was lovely, great views of water and mountains, clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Rooms, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Used restaurant every morning for breakfast, which was menu or buffet. The buffet was good quality and very good value.
reviews.title: Poor customer service

reviews.text: Only negative point was that the pool area was a bit drab. Small pool, never seemed to be in the sun, slight excess of bird poo aound the pool!
reviews.title: Great location ....
5* Location and Lobby - 3* Rooms - 2* Beds!
reviews.text: This hotel gets 5* for location (on Burrard Street with Robson Street and the Fairmont on the doorstep - Canada Place etc within walking distance). We were actually slightly disappointed with the shopping on Robson Street - it was hyped as Vancouver's answer to 5th Avenue, but we felt that the Park Royal mall (just over Lion's Gate Bridge was much better).
Back to the hotel, the lobby has recently undergone a major multi-million dollar renovation and really looks the part. An excellent coffee shop offering good value pastries, paninis and drinks.
reviews.title: typical hyatt
excellent stay
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for 3 nights this December. The first night was business and the rest was holiday. This hotel is the perfect location for either. It's walking distance to the business sector, the waterfront, Robson Street and many retail stores and restaurants. At $145 Cdn. per night, the rate was very good value; perhaps reflecting that early December is probably low season for Vancouver tourism. The room was very nice. We requested and received a room at the very top (32nd floor), which had a very good view of the harbour and the mountains. The service was very good, especially the concierge. She provided extremely good restaurant advice for all three days, including getting us reservations on the Saturday night at one of the most popular restarants in town (which was likely not an easy task). Both the front check-in staff and the full time doormen were both friendly, helpful and efficient. Their are a number of other topflight hotels in the same area (Sutton Place, Four Seasons, Fairmont Hotel Vancouver, to name a few), and it was my opinion that our stay at the Hyatt was very much at the same high level of quality and service, but at a somewhat lesser price. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel for anyone looking to spend a few days in Vancouver

reviews.title: OK but over-rated
reviews.text: For a hotel of this class and price, the Hyatt is nothing special. The view is the best feature if you get an appropriate room. Room ammenities are minimal and internet costs money (still, as of Oct 2005), where most hotels now offer this free. The food is outlandishly expensive, moreso than nicer hotels I have stayed at - if you have the breakfast buffet, go hungry. Hyatt's beauty is only skin deep.

we only stayed one nite before our cruise, but thought the hotel was very nice, clean and I know others complained about having to use your key in the elevator but we thought this was a great idea for safety reasons.
reviews.title: satisfied with accomidations

reviews.text: Hotel had great location. we had a room with a small balcony that we could overlook the city.
reviews.title: Good Value if you negotiate a good rate

reviews.text: Beds and pillows were fine.
reviews.title: Great location, good deals on priceline, not worth the regular rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a super hotel. The beds are super comfortable. The bathroom is super modern, the shower faucet comes straight down on top of you from the middle of the tub, this takes a little getting used to.
reviews.title: This hotel has everything

reviews.text: The parking is expensive $28.00.if you want to save some money
reviews.title: Pretty good for a Hyatt Regency

likes.liked: — Good size and quality of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: take the B-Line right down Granville Street to the Burrard Station, this will let you off right in front of the door to the hotel.
reviews.title: Horrible check in computers and they'll nickel and dime you to death

reviews.text: Location is great, there are so many great restaurants on Alberni Street & Robson.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Comfortable bed, nice room, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — High price for food in restaurant

reviews.text: The fitness room was great also.
reviews.title: Room Service until 11pm?!

description: Cosmopolitan. Urbane. Stylish. From the moment you arrive at the Four Diamond Hyatt Regency Vancouver, it’s clear there’s more here than meets the eye. Be treated to plush amenities and uncompromising service in a downtown Vancouver hotel that boasts the largest guestrooms, most impressive meeting and event facilities, romantic wedding venues, and accomplished catering staff of any accommodation in Vancouver.Help green the planet with a stay at Hyatt Regency Vancouver. The first downtown hotel to be awarded five keys, the highest rating, by the HAC Green Key Program our Vancouver Hyatt uses the services of Bullfrog Power (100% green electricity from wind power) for all its meeting rooms.Let the luxurious Hyatt Regency Vancouver be your ideal starting point to explore everything this dynamic city offers. Freshly updated to reflect the excitement and vibrancy of Vancouver, our hotel is surrounded by the bustling business center; moments from unique shops and engaging entertainment. For business travel or vacation, reward yourself with a stay at the favored choice of hotels in Vancouver, British Columbia.
